rationale: The architecture is useful for a staged research workflow, but current evidence does not justify immediate full production deployment. Core guarantees depend on strong assumptions, and empirical reporting is mainly directional with narrow market coverage.
rejection_reasons: Reject immediate full-production deployment because theoretical assumptions are not validated for the intended operating regime.
Reject direct strategy promotion because experimental evidence is narrow in scope (single market/year) and mostly directional.
Reject live-capital usage without explicit cost, slippage, turnover, and robustness controls.
follow_up_recommendations: Implement the two-loop system in deterministic shadow mode with immutable run artifacts.
Add strict promotion gates for walk-forward stability, cost-aware performance, turnover, and drawdown limits.
Run ablations to quantify incremental value of inner loop, outer loop, retrieval, and judge configuration.
Add KB provenance, deduplication, and decay/retirement governance before scaling iteration volume.
Require human approval before any transition from paper-trading to production exposure.
